data.enText: to state clearly and firmly that sth is true
She continued to assert that she was innocent.
She continued to assert her innocence.

data.chText: 人们普遍确认，老年人更愿意由家人照顾。
data.enText: It is commonly asserted that older people prefer to receive care from family members.

data.chText: 坚持自己的主张；表现坚定
data.enText: to behave in a confident and determined way so that other people pay attention to your opinions

data.chText: 维护自己的权利（或权威）
data.enText: to make other people recognize your right or authority to do sth, by behaving firmly and confidently

data.chText: 我决心一开始就维护我的权威。
data.enText: I was determined to assert my authority from the beginning.
to start to have an effect

simple_means.memory_skill: as 加强 + sert 加入，插入 → 强行插入观点 → 断言

means: 维护自己的权利(或权威)

ex.chText: 她坚称法国菜是世界上最好的。
ex.enText: She asserted that French cooking is the best in the world.

ex.chText: 那位科学家断言月球上没有水。
ex.enText: The scientist asserted that there is no water on the moon.

synonyms.bx: 含较强的主观意味，指坚决而明确地表示某事真实无误。

ex.enText: He contended that it was true.

ex.chText: 我认为失业是当今最为严重的社会弊病。
ex.enText: I would contend that unemployment is the most serious social problem today.

synonyms.bx: 指声称某事属实，含有与他人进行争辩的意思。

ex.chText: 他坚称自己曾看见过飞碟。
ex.enText: He maintains that he once saw a UFO.

synonyms.bx: 指坚决维护某种主张或观点等。

ex.enText: He affirmed the rumors of a pay increase.
She affirmed that he told the truth.

synonyms.bx: 指公开宣称某事属实，强调坚信不疑的态度。

ex.chText: 据称杰克打了威尔逊先生的头。
ex.enText: It was alleged that Jack had struck Mr. Wilson on the head.

ex.chText: 小偷声称警方逼迫他作假口供。
ex.enText: The thief alleged that the police forced him to make a false confession.

synonyms.bx: 尤指在未证实的情况下宣称某事属实，或声称某人行事错误或违法，常用被动语态。

ex.chText: 他坚称法国电影是世界上最好的。
ex.enText: French movies, he asserted, are the best in the world.
He asserted that he was an honest man.

synonyms.bx: 指断然声称某种结论，多为主观判断，往往并无证据，或有证据但不一定确实。

example: The letter asserts a free society

tr: to declare or affirm solemnly and formally as true
example: Before God I swear I am innocent

tr: insist on having one's opinions and rights recognized

value.def: If someone asserts a fact or belief, they state it firmly.

example.ex: Mr. Helm plans to assert that the bill violates the First Amendment...
example.tran: 赫尔姆先生打算声明该法案违反了宪法第一修正案。

example.ex: The defendants, who continue to assert their innocence, are expected to appeal...
example.tran: 各被告仍然坚称无辜，预计会提起上诉。

example.ex: Altman asserted, 'We were making a political statement about western civilisation and greed.'
example.tran: 奥尔特曼坚称，“我们那时正要发表一份关于西方文明和贪婪的政治宣言。”

example.ex: There is no concrete evidence to support assertions that the recession is truly over.
example.tran: 尚无确凿的证据支持经济衰退确已结束的论断。

value.def: If you assert your authority, you make it clear by your behaviour that you have authority.

example.ex: After the war, the army made an attempt to assert its authority in the south of the country...
example.tran: 战后，军队试图在该国的南部地区维护其统治地位。

example.ex: The people have asserted their power and that will be very difficult to reverse.
example.tran: 人民已经维护了其当家作主的权力，这将难以改变。

example.ex: The decision is seen as an assertion of his authority within the company.
example.tran: 这个决定被看作是他在公司内部对自己权威的维护。

value.def: If you assert your right or claim to something, you insist that you have the right to it.

example.ex: The republics began asserting their right to govern themselves.
example.tran: 各加盟共和国开始要求获得自治权。

example.ex: These institutions have made the assertion of ethnic identity possible.
example.tran: 这些制度使实现民族认同的主张成为可能。

value.def: If you assert yourself, you speak and act in a forceful way, so that people take notice of you.

example.ex: He's speaking up and asserting himself confidently.
example.tran: 他明确表态，信心十足地阐述自己的观点。

value.tran: 坚持（自己）的主张;表现坚定

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to join, to insert 加入, 插入
rootsaffixes.title: sert

partsOfSpeech.dec: as 加强 + sert 加入，插入 → 强行插入观点 → 断言
assert 断言；主张 + ion 表动作 → 坚决断言；声明
assert 断言；主张 + ive …的 → 断言的；确定的
de 去掉 + sert 加入，插入 → 不加入；不让插入 → 离开；抛弃
ex 出 + sert 加入，插入 → 插出去 → 突出
in 进入 + sert 加入，插入 → 插入进去 → 插入
insert 插入 + ion 表名词 → 插入
